citation.article-title: Roseomonas frigidaquae sp. nov., isolated from a water-cooling system
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Roseomonas frigidaquae sp. nov.

Roseomonas frigidaquae (fri.gi.da′quae. L. adj. frigidus cold; L. fem. n. aqua water; N.L. gen. n. frigidaquae from/of cold water, referring to the isolation of the type strain from a water-cooling system).
Cells are coccobacilli (0.6–0.8×0.8–1.0 μm in size) that occur singly and in pairs.
Gram-negative, non-motile, non-spore-forming, strictly aerobic and pale-pink-pigmented.
Grows best on media such as TSA, nutrient agar and R2A agar.
Grows on MacConkey agar.
Colonies on TSA are convex, circular, smooth and opaque with entire margins, approx. 2 mm in diameter after 5 days at 30 °C (pH 7).
Growth occurs in 0–3 % (w/v) NaCl (optimally at 0.5 %), at pH 6–10 (optimally at pH 7) and at 15–37 °C (optimally at 30 °C).
Oxidase and catalase activities are present.
H2S and indole are not produced.
Tween 20 is hydrolysed, but casein, DNA, aesculin, gelatin, starch, tyrosine, Tween 80, urea and xylan are not hydrolysed.
The Voges–Proskauer test and the methyl red reaction are negative.
In the API 20E strip, the ONPG reaction is negative.
Nitrate is reduced to nitrite, but with no gas.
Acid is not produced from the following (at 0.5 %, w/v): cellobiose, fructose, galactose, glucose, lactose, maltose, mannose, rhamnose, starch, sucrose and xylose.
Citrate is not utilized.
None of the substrates in the API 20NE and API 50 CH strips is utilized as a sole carbon source.
In the API ZYM gallery, acid phosphatase, alkaline phosphatase, esterase (C4) and α-glucosidase activities are positive and esterase lipase (C8) is weakly positive.

Cells are sensitive to (μg per disc, unless otherwise indicated) amikacin (30), ampicillin (10), chloramphenicol (30), erythromycin (15), gentamicin (10), kanamycin (30), nalidixic acid (30), penicillin G (10 IU), streptomycin (10) and tetracycline, but resistant to polymyxin B (300 IU) and vancomycin (30).
Major fatty acids are C18 : 1ω7c and C16 : 0 (see Supplementary Table S1 for the complete fatty acid composition of the type strain).
Q-10 is the predominant quinone.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 69.5 mol%.
The type strain, CW67T (=KCTC 22211T =JCM 15073T), was isolated from a water-cooling system at an oxygen-producing plant in Gwangyang, Republic of Korea.
